page.title: 11HILBRE ISLAND,THE ESTUARY.
page.content: Although the main island is out of the block we felt that it was such an important natural feature and facility that it had to be mentioned.It is one of three islands,the other two being known as The Middle Eye and The Little Eye. The estuary of the River Dee is famous for the quantity and the variety of its wildlife especially the birdlife and Hilbre Island is one of the best places for visitors to go to view these birds.The island covers about five acres and is a bird sanctuary with a resident ranger who is carrying out a number of conservation projects. Grey seals are also readily spotted all the year round and many thousands of people make the two mile walk from West Kirby promenade to the island.
